title: LDF govt. recast ‘inequitable’ Vizhinjam port contract to Kerala’s advantage, says CM
content: CM says the initial contract signed by the Cong. govt. deprived the State of profit from the port’s operations for the first two decades, despite Kerala bearing 60% of the cost. The LDF govt. then signed an even-handed supplementary concession contract annulling the original deed, he says

title: A. Jayathilak succeeds Sarada Muraleedharan as Chief Secretary of Kerala
content: Jayathilak, who was serving as Additional Chief Secretary (Finance), is the 50th Chief Secretary of the State

title: Kochi City police to step up vigil around apartment complexes following high-profile drug bust cases
content: Two prominent Malayalam film directors and a rapper were nabbed with suspected ganja from two different apartments in the city on successive days

title: A.P. Minister announces 3% quota for sports persons in DSC
content: Of the 16,347 teacher posts in the State, 421 have been allocated for people applying under the sports quota, says Mandipalli Ramprasad Reddy

title: Firm seeks three months to repair escalator at moffusil bus in Kozhikode
content: The escalator is part of the first-ever mechanised foot overbridge in the State, which connects the bus stand with the V.K. Krishnamenon Indoor Stadium across Rajaji Road

title: Anita Ratnam moves Madras High Court against infringement of her personality rights
content: Justice Senthilkumar Ramamoorthy directs Meta Platforms Inc and Telegram FZ-LLC to take down fake Facebook accounts and Telegram channels that had misused her photos, videos and voice

title: Maratha row: Manoj Jarange Patil to launch indefinite fast in Mumbai on August 29
content: The activist has accused the State of reneging on quota promises; warns of large-scale mobilisation if demands remain unmet

title: 64% of Simhachalam temple redevelopment works are completed so far, says Endowments Minister
content: Anam Ramanarayana Reddy expresses shock over the death of seven devotees in the wall collapse incident at the temple

title: Caste enumeration in census: Rahul Gandhi says ‘We support decision but want timeline of implementation’
content: While reiterating the demand for removing the 50% cap on reservations, Mr. Gandhi said funds should be allocated for the caste census

title: Three youths get six-months imprisonment for stealing bike
content: The theft occurred in August 2024 and all the three accused are residents of Bhimavaram mandal in West Godavari district

title: Six killed, one injured as car rams into house in Kovur
content: AP Chief Minister Nara Chandrababu Naidu expressed grief and assured that the state government will stand by the affected families

title: Kerala rapper Vedan released on bail in suspected leopard tooth pendant case
content: Rapper informs court that he was not aware that it was a leopard tooth and it was gifted to him by a fan

title: QR code launched to locate police stations in Kozhikode
content: The initiative, named ‘Police Finder’, was completed under sub-inspector Manoj Babu (Traffic), who retired from service on April 30, 2025

title: Hindu seer urges removal of Aurangzeb’s tomb
content: Pragyananand Saraswati Maharaj of Dwarka Sharda Peeth appeals to Maharashtra CM, citing historical grievances; remarks draw concern amid rising communal tensions

title: Chittoor Collector asks officials to prepare plans in advance to solve drinking water woes
content: Sumit Kumar instructs MPDOs and RWS officials to visit villages, make sure that drinking water is supplied, and take necessary steps if water is found to be polluted

title: Revanth Reddy hails Union Cabinet’s decision to conduct caste census, credits Rahul Gandhi for it
content: Mr. Reddy reminded that Telangana was the first State to conduct a caste survey in 2024, based on Rahul Gandhi’s vision and direction

title: Kerala records 100% pass in ISC, 99.94% in ICSE exams
content: Girls did better than boys in the ICSE examinations with a pass percentage of 99.95. Boys registered 99.92% marks

title: EC organises training for grassroot poll officials
content: The training is part of poll body’s ongoing preparations for the coming Assembly polls in Bihar and other States

title: ANGRAU Diamond Jubilee: MP calls for focused research on doubling farmers’ income
content: Inter-departmental synergy at ANGRAU can help research reach the last mile, ensuring a meaningful impact at the grassroots level, says Lavu Sri Krishna Devarayalu

title: Processions, cultural programmes mark Basava Jayanti in several districts
content: Festive spirit pervades the districts of Dharwad, Haveri, Gadag, Uttara Kannada and Davangere as people remember the 12th century social reformer Basavanna who strived for an egalitarian society

title: Vizhinjam port the brainchild of the 1996 LDF government, says Pinarayi
content: Kerala Chief Minister criticises insinuations that the Vizhinjam port is the Central government’s bequest. State had invested the bulk share (₹5,595 crore out of the total ₹8,967 crore), while the Centre’s viability gap funding loan of ₹818 crore is yet to materialise, he says

title: Nandyal MP assures to take up Owk reservoir issues with government
content: As the capacity of the reservoir has been increased and two new gates installed, the revetment of the reservoir has partially caved in and needs repairs, say officials

title: Special prayers offered to Sri Lakshmi Narasimhaswamy on Akshaya Tritiya
content: The temple, believed to be constructed in 13th Century wore a festive look as devotees arrived to offer prayers to the presiding deities

title: Govt. prepared to spend ₹15,000 crore for paddy procurement during rabi, says Uttam Kumar Reddy
content: The Irrigation and Civil Supplies  Minister terms this as the biggest procurement operation in the country

title: Health department announces a one-health protocol for early detection of Amoebic meningoencephalitis
content: Government says Amoebic meningoencephalitis infections peak during summer when amoebic activity increases as water levels decrease

title: Delhi High Court asks Centre reply after plea seeks official to conduct boxing federation poll
content: Justice Mini Pushkarna issued notice to the federation and the Centre on the application filed by Delhi Amateur Boxing Association and posted the matter in August

title: In Lord Krishna's land, many temples reject call to boycott Muslims, say bhakti transcends boundaries
content: "Bhakti is supreme in Brijmandal. If someone has faith and comes for darshan, why should we oppose it?"

title: Actor Sreenath Bhasi likely to be made witness in Alappuzha hybrid ganja case
content: Excise department officials said that the actor would be served a notice asking him to record his statement before a magistrate

title: SSK takes up various projects in Kozhikode amid fund crunch
content: The projects are being implemented at a time when the Centre has withheld the State’s due share for not signing the PM Schools for Rising India (PM SHRI) agreement

title: 710 candidates to appear for NEET exam in Chittoor district
content: 432 candidates will take the examination at the PVKN Degree College and 278 will appear for the examination at the Savitramma Women’s Degree College on May 4 from 2 p.m. to 5 p.m. for admissions into MBBS, BDS, and BHMS courses

title: Congress and allies opposed the caste census for decades while in power: Amit Shah
content: Hours after the Cabinet Committee on Political Affairs (CCPA) took the significant decision, the Home Minister said the government has shown its strong commitment towards social equality and the rights of every section

title: Satheesan highlights UDF’s contribution to Vizhinjam port project
content: He says the steps to make the port a reality were taken by the Chandy-led UDF government that came to power in 2011. Leader of the Opposition says many agreements made as part of the project have not been implemented by the LDF govt.

title: Minimum qualifying marks for A.P. Mega DSC exam revised
content: The minimum qualifying marks for SCs, STs, BCs and PwDs in language, non-language subjects under SA and TGT categories have been revised from 45% to 40%

title: Passport Act provisions applicable to foreign citizens as well: Kerala HC
content: The court observes that even if entry of a foreigner to India is lawful, his stay without valid documents required for such stay will attract Section 14- A(b) of Foreigners Act, 1946

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: NFL fines Falcons, DC over Sanders prank call
content: The NFL has fined the Falcons $250,000 and defensive coordinator Jeff Ulbrich $100,000 in response to a prank call made by Ulbrich's son to Shedeur Sanders during the NFL draft.

title: Report: Elway driving cart as ex-agent injured
content: John Elway was the driver of a golf cart when his business partner and former agent fell from the vehicle and suffered life-threatening injuries, according to a TMZ report.

title: Source: Falcons to pick up London's 5th-yr. option
content: The Falcons will pick up wide receiver Drake London's fifth-year option, a source tells ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Giannis: Haliburton's dad 'disrespectful' with antics
content: Bucks forward Giannis Antetokounmpo got into a heated confrontation with the father of Pacers guard Tyrese Haliburton following Game 5, spurred by what Antetokounmpo called a "disrespectful" exchange on the floor.

title: Brunson a bystander as Knicks wilt late in loss
content: As precious seconds ticked away in the fourth quarter Tuesday night, New York star Jalen Brunson was waiting at the scorer's table for a whistle in the Knicks' 106-103 loss to the Detroit Pistons, who stayed alive in this Round 1 series, forcing a Game 6.

title: Celts pounce after Banchero sits, oust Magic in 5
content: The Celtics broke open Tuesday night's game after Paolo Banchero went to the bench with his fifth foul and rolled to a 120-89 victory to close out the series in five games.

title: 'Confident' Castle gives Spurs back-to-back ROYs
content: Stephon Castle garnered 92 of 100 available first-place votes to give the Spurs the franchise's fourth Rookie of the Year award.

title: PWHL picks Seattle for 2nd expansion franchise
content: The PWHL will expand to eight teams next season by adding Seattle as its second new franchise alongside Vancouver, and The Associated Press has learned that plans are already in the works to add two more in a year's time.

title: Why the Rockets' launch is still awaiting a superstar
content: Only one young player is untouchable as the Rockets enter an offseason with lucrative draft capital and a promising future.

title: College Football Playoff impact: Players who stuck around
content: The portal has closed, the draft is over, so who are the best players who stuck around even though they had options?

title: What another disappointing first-round loss means for Giannis and the Bucks: 'I don't know'
content: Year 2 of the Giannis-Dame partnership was supposed to fuel a title run in Milwaukee. Where can the franchise turn now after another first-round exit?

title: Damian Lillard's injury timeline, plus what to learn from other NBA stars' Achilles tears
content: The Bucks guard faces a long recovery, but there is precedent for stars in their 30s making a full comeback.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Two elimination games on tap, and a pivotal Game 5 in Jets-Blues
content: Will the playoff field shrink Wednesday night? Here are keys to each game, plus Tuesday's recaps, Three Stars.

title: Athletic aim to keep Williams amid PL interest
content: Ernesto Valverde has said he's hopeful Athletic Club can fend off interest from Barcelona and the Premier League and keep Nico Williams in Bilbao next season.

title: Sources: Ancelotti's move to Brazil hits impasse
content: Real Madrid are unhappy with the timing and financial arrangements of Carlo Ancelotti's exit from the club, leaving his reported move to take over as coach of the Brazil national team in jeopardy, sources told ESPN Brasil.

title: Marinakis withdraws control at UCL-chasing Forest
content: Evangelos Marinakis has taken a step back from his ownership duties at Nottingham Forest as the club gear up for Champions League qualification.

title: Sources: Dier agrees to join Monaco as free agent
content: Bayern Munich defender Eric Dier has agreed to join Monaco as a free agent when his contract expires in the summer, sources have told ESPN.

title: Inter's Martínez plays down Yamal-Messi links
content: Inter Milan captain Lautaro Martínez has said he is impressed by Lamine Yamal but added that there is no comparison between Barcelona's teenage sensation and Lionel Messi.

title: Man Utd boost as Amad, De Ligt return to training
content: Manchester United have been handed a boost ahead of their Europa League semifinal against Athletic Club after Amad Diallo and Matthijs de Ligt returned to training.

title: Wrexham to hold stadium promotion party for fans
content: Wrexham is keeping the party going after sealing a third-straight promotion by throwing a ticket-only end-of-year awards ceremony for fans.

title: Injured PSG hero Dembélé a 'doubt' for 2nd leg
content: Luis Enrique said Paris Saint-Germain can reach the Champions League final with or without match-winning goalscorer Ousmane Dembélé after the forward limped out of Tuesday's 1-0 semifinal first-leg win at Arsenal.

title: From Rory to JT, looking back at top players and moments
content: Through half of the 2025 season we've seen Rory McIlroy dominate, Justin Thomas get back in the winner's circle and Scottie Scheffler start a bit slower than expected.

title: 'They tell you to keep it down -- don't listen': 30 years of Coors Field horror stories
content: For three decades, baseball at the Rockies' park has bruised ERAs and egos. Here's what it's like on MLB's scariest mound.

title: Home theater, bowling alley and more highlight Deion Sanders' former home listing
content: Sanders' former mansion, which includes a number of impressive amenities, sits on 5.95 acres of land in Texas.

title: After a disappointing weekend, the power now belongs to Shedeur Sanders
content: From here on out, all that matters for Shedeur Sanders is proving the Browns were right in selecting him.

title: Top 10 transfer portal winners: SEC leads the pack
content: Whether remaking rosters or filling needs, Tennessee, Ole Miss, South Carolina and LSU won the transfer portal.

title: Transfer rankings: All eyes on Kneepkens, Williams
content: Ta'Niya Latson tops the rankings, while Gianna Kneepkens and Serah Williams still have decisions to make.

title: 2024-25 report cards for every Big East team (plus a few others)
content: How should UConn be graded after falling short of its third straight national title? Our verdicts on each team.

title: Bracketology: Debut predictions for the 2025-26 season
content: With a bevy of returning talent, Purdue earns the top overall seed in the first edition of our projected field.

title: PSG's Dembélé shows Arsenal what they're missing: a clinical forward
content: Paris Saint-Germain take advantage of their Champions League semifinal first leg against Arsenal, but will the Gunners find a way to turn it around in Paris?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona eye move for $54M-rated Rashford
content: Marcus Rashford reportedly has his heart set on a move to Barcelona. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Fantasy Football Cheat Sheet Central
content: Our collection of downloadable, printable cheat sheets for the 2025 fantasy football season, including PPR, non-PPR and dynasty/keeper leagues.

title: Five rookies with breakout potential
content: The 2025 WNBA draft class offers a number of Day 1 contributors outside of Paige Bueckers. Here's who to keep an eye on in fantasy drafts.

title: UFC 318 reactions: What would a BMF title win mean for Dustin Poirier?
content: Dustin Poirier will take on ex-featherweight champion Max Holloway one last time for the BMF title at UFC 318.

title: Centre Announces Caste Census, Rahul Gandhi Says Remove 50% Quota Cap
content: Congress's Rahul Gandhi said today that the Centre's decision to club caste census with next year's population census is a welcome step though taken under pressure.

title: Court Warns Of Action Against Malaika Arora In Saif Hotel Brawl Case
content: Noting that actor Malaika Arora was "intentionally" avoiding the legal proceedings by failing to appear as a witness in a 2012 hotel brawl case involving co-star Saif Ali Khan, a court in Mumbai has granted her last chance.

title: Trump Says He Could Help Man Who Was Mistakenly Deported, But Will Not
content: US President Donald Trump says he could help return an El Salvadoran man mistakenly deported from Maryland, but would not despite court-ordered action, in contrast to his administration's arguments that only El Salvador can act.

title: Prosecution's Theory "Full Of Holes": Supreme Court Acquits 2 Rape Convicts
content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday acquitted two rape convicts on finding the prosecution's theory "full of holes" raising grave suspicion.

title: Opinion: Blog | Vaibhav Suryavanshi: From Samastipur To IPL, With Love
content: Vaibhav was 13 when he was bought by the Rajasthan Royals, and yet, when he strides out to bat, the cameras never pick up even an iota of nervousness, neither on his face nor in his body language.

title: Pahalgam Terror Attack Live Updates: India Warns Pak; Meeting Over Water Pact Underway At Amit Shah's House
content: Pahalgam Terror Attack Live Updates: The Cabinet Committee on Security (CCS) headed by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday reviewed the overall security situation in Jammu & Kashmir in the wake of the terror attack in Pahalgam.

title: Must Pay The Price: Rahul Gandhi On Those Behind Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said on Wednesday that those responsible for the Pahalgam terror attack must pay the price for what they have done, and Prime Minister Narendra Modi must act strongly.

title: Buying Book Not Enough, Have To Read It Too: Prashant Kishor On Caste Census
content: Election strategist-turned politician Prashant Kishor pointed out today that the caste census in itself is not a problem. Nor it is a promise that possession of data will immediately rectify social problems and bring equality.

title: On Centre's Caste Census Move, Opposition Claims Big Victory
content: Allies Congress and Lalu Yadav's Rashtriya Janata Dal, nationally as well as in Bihar, have claimed credit for the Centre's move to include caste figures in the next Census.

title: 2 Pak Men Remain In Telangana Jails After Home Country Refuses To Take Them
content: Two Pakistani nationals, who completed their prison terms, are under detention in Telangana jails for several years pending their deportation, as the neighbouring country has refused to accept them as citizens, officials said.

title: Ukraine Expected To Sign Landmark Mineral Deal With US Today: Report
content: Ukraine is prepared to sign a landmark mineral resources agreement with the United States in Washington on Wednesday, according to two senior Ukrainian officials.

title: Supreme Court To Hear Petition On Pahalgam Terror Attack Tomorrow
content: The Supreme Court will hear a petition tomorrow on forming a judicial commission headed by a retired judge of the top court to investigate the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam that killed 26 tourists.

title: Trapped For 16 Hours, Cat Rescued From Kolkata's Fire-Hit Hotel
content: Amidst the devastation of the Kolkata hotel fire that claimed 14 lives, a small moment of relief unfolded on Wednesday when fire brigade personnel rescued a cat that was trapped inside the building for over 16 hours.

title: Rahul Gandhi Meets Pahalgam Attack Victim's Family In UP, Demand Justice
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi visited the family members of Shubham Dwivedi, who was among the 26 people killed in the Pahalgam terror attack, and said the opposition is demanding a special session of Parliament to ensure the victims get justice.

title: Pakistan Cancels All Flights To PoK As Tensions With India Soar: Report
content: Days after shutting its airspace to all flights owned and operated by Indian carriers, Pakistan today cancelled its own flights to the Gilgit-Baltistan region of Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

title: 2 Boys Stab Men After They Ask Them Not To Stand Outside Women's Toilet
content: Two juveniles were apprehended for allegedly stabbing two men after they asked them not to stand outside a women's public toilet here, police said Wednesday.

title: After J&K Attack, India Warns Pak Over Unprovoked Firing: Report
content: Amid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan after last week's terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam, in which 26 people were killed, key military officials of both countries have spoken over the hotline.

title: Despite Price Surge, India Sees Gold, Silver Buying On Akshaya Tritiya
content: Gold and silver buying in India -- the world's largest gold consumer -- kicked off positively on Wednesday's auspicious Akshaya Tritiya festival despite high prices, with the jewellers' body GJC projecting gold sales jump.

title: She Could Not Blink For Bank KYC. How It Led To Landmark Top Court Verdict
content: The Supreme Court's landmark judgment, stressing that digital access is intrinsic to the right to life, follows a long legal battle led by an acid attack survivor whose inability to blink had become an obstacle in opening a bank account in her name.

title: Facing Trump, Microsoft Vows To Protect Europeans' Data
content: Microsoft on Wednesday committed to boosting its presence in Europe and protecting European citizens' data against a backdrop of rising "geopolitical volatility".

title: Telangana rolls out centralised online services for driving licences and vehicle registration
content: Karnataka Today Your daily dose of news highlights from the world of cinema and streaming . today's Cache Your download of the top 5 technology stories of the day . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science .

title: India warns Pakistan against violating ceasefire along LoC
content: Following Pakistan's unprovoked firing along the LoC, the DGMOs of India and Pakistan spoke via hotline, with India issuing a strong warning. This occurred amidst rising tensions after the Pahalgam terror attack, where 26 tourists were killed. The CCS, headed by PM Modi, met to discuss India's response, granting the armed forces operational freedom regarding retaliation.

title: 'Trying to steal credit': BJP slams Rahul's remark on caste census decision
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi welcomed the union cabinet's decision to conduct a caste census, emphasising it as the initial step towards comprehensive social reform. He urged the government to provide a clear timeline for completion, highlighting public and political pressure as key drivers.

title: Why Khalistanis are the biggest losers of Canadian election
content: The federal election didn’t just retire the idea that stumbling through woke homilies and imaginary genders is politics — it also retired the last shreds of political legitimacy clung to by Canada’s Khalistani proxies. From Ontario to British Columbia, the message was clear: you can’t run a country while moonlighting as the foreign ministry for a fictitious ethno-theocracy with a proclivity to blow up planes. Unless one is America, of course.

title: Insta accounts of Hania Aamir, Ali Zafar & other Pakistani influencers banned
content: India has blocked Instagram accounts of Pakistani influencers like Hania Aamir and Mahira Khan, citing a legal request. This action follows a similar ban on 16 Pakistani YouTube channels, including prominent media outlets, for allegedly spreading provocative content.

title: Watch: Hardik Pandya runs across the ground to hug Rahul Dravid
content: Ahead of their IPL 2025 match, Hardik Pandya and Rahul Dravid, India's former coach, shared a heartwarming reunion in Jaipur. Dravid, recovering from an injury, stood to greet Pandya, reminiscing about their T20 World Cup victory. The emotional visuals, shared by Rajasthan Royals, quickly went viral, highlighting the special bond between the two cricket figures.

title: Centre has approved caste census: What is it and why it matters
content: India is set to include caste enumeration in its upcoming census, a practice discontinued post-independence except for SCs and STs. This decision, driven by political and social demands, aims to provide insights into caste-based socio-economic disparities. The data could reshape affirmative action policies and address inequalities, though some fear it may reinforce divisions.

title: 'Don't know if I'm coming for the next game': Dhoni on retirement query
content: MS Dhoni playfully teased fans about his IPL future after losing the toss against Punjab Kings, leaving them guessing about his return next season. He then discussed CSK's home form and frequent team changes due to inconsistent performances following the auction. Shreyas Iyer, winning the toss, opted to field, revealing Glenn Maxwell's injury and an undecided replacement.

title: Apple CEO on US-made iPhones: I don’t like to employ all these people foreign, but...
content: Apple CEO Tim Cook told Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick that advanced robotics are essential for bringing iPhone manufacturing to the U.S. Amid tariff concerns, Apple secured a temporary exemption, aiding stock recovery. While diversifying production to India, challenges persist with Chinese export approvals, framing this shift as part of an AI-driven industrial revolution with high-paying technician jobs.

title: US economy contracts 0.3% in Q1 2025; Trump blames it on Biden 'overhang’
content: The US economy unexpectedly contracted by 0.3% in the first quarter of 2025, falling short of expectations. This downturn is attributed to a surge in imports ahead of President Trump's new tariffs and a deceleration in consumer and government spending. While Trump blames Biden, his advisor cites pre-tariff import activities as the cause.

title: Google is making changes to its salary structure: Here's what it means
content: Google is revamping its performance review system to allocate larger bonuses and equity awards to high-achieving employees, potentially decreasing compensation for those with lower performance ratings. This adjustment, set to influence end-of-year reviews and 2026 compensation, aims to incentivize top contributors. While some employees may receive reduced bonuses, Google maintains its commitment to competitive compensation and benefits.

title: Trent Boult on bowling to 14-yr-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi: 'Going to be ...'
content: Trent Boult of Mumbai Indians anticipates facing Rajasthan Royals' Vaibhav Suryavanshi. Boult acknowledges Suryavanshi's impressive form. He sees it as an exciting challenge. Boult praises Suryavanshi's fearless approach. Mumbai Indians are on a five-match winning streak. They aim to improve further. The match between Mumbai Indians and Rajasthan Royals is crucial.

title: India can hit Pak by regulating water flow timing, denying data
content: While immediate stoppage of water flow to Pakistan is difficult due to infrastructure limitations, India can regulate flow during winter using existing dams, potentially impacting Pakistan's wheat crop. To exert greater control, India needs to expedite hydropower projects and increase water storage capacity. Abeyance of the Indus Water Treaty allows India to strategically manage its river resources, enhancing water security.

title: Watch: What happened after Kuldeep slapped Rinku Singh
content: Following a tense IPL match between Delhi Capitals and Kolkata Knight Riders, a playful interaction between Kuldeep Yadav and Rinku Singh went viral, showcasing their strong off-field camaraderie. Despite Rinku's earlier aggressive batting against Kuldeep, the video captured laughter and friendship, highlighting the positive spirit amidst the competition. KKR secured a 14-run victory, keeping their playoff hopes alive.

title: US stock markets open sharply lower as economic contraction sparks selloff
content: US markets opened in red as the economy unexpectedly shrank by 0.3% in the first quarter, driven by increased imports and slower consumer spending. The decline raised concerns about President Trump's tariff policies, with the Dow, Nasdaq, and S&P 500 all experiencing significant drops. European and Asian markets showed mixed reactions amidst global trade uncertainties.

title: Garcia? Teofimo? Canelo? Inoue? A lapsed fan's guide to Cinco de Mayo weekend
content: this weekend will see three consecutive nights of fight cards featuring four current or former ESPN pound-for-pound fighters . Easily the most unique location of the weekend is Times Square in New York City, where Garcia, Haney and Lopez will compete in separate fights in the renowned public space .

title: High gold prices cast a shadow over Akshaya Tritiya jewellery sale
content: Karnataka Today Your daily dose of news highlights from the world of cinema and streaming . today's Cache Your download of the top 5 technology stories of the day . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science .

title: Govt announces caste survey will be part of next census; Vaishnaw slams Cong
content: The Union Cabinet has decided to include a caste enumeration in the upcoming national census, as announced by Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw. He criticized the Congress party for their alleged historical opposition to such a census, while also pointing out the non-transparent and politically motivated caste surveys conducted by some state governments.

title: Bangladesh court gives bail to Chinmoy Das in sedition case
content: A Bangladesh court granted bail to former Iskcon leader Chinmoy Krishna Das in a sedition case after his arrest sparked widespread outrage. The charges stemmed from the hoisting of a saffron flag above Bangladesh's official flag during a rally in Chattogram. Das, spokesperson for a minority rights group, advocates for Hindu community reforms and organized large public rallies.

title: Olympic medallist Mary Kom announces divorce
content: Olympic medallist Mary Kom has officially confirmed her divorce from Karung Onkholer, finalised on December 20, 2023, under customary law. Addressing false rumours circulating about her personal life, including alleged relationships with Hitesh Choudhary and another boxer's husband, Kom issued a legal notice. She clarified the amicable nature of the divorce and requested privacy, warning against further misinformation.

title: Celtics star Jaylen Brown loves anime, lists his favourites
content: Boston Celtics star Jaylen Brown has revealed his love for anime, listing titles like Demon Slayer and Death Note as favorites. Brown appreciates the high-level writing in anime and even shared his passion with former teammate Tacko Fall, watching Baki together. It's refreshing to see NBA stars enjoying anime's emotional stories and deeper messages.

title: Tata Nexon survives parking lift collapse, sedan falling on roof: Details
content: A Tata Nexon demonstrated its robust build quality in a multi-level parking mishap. A lift carrying another car collapsed onto the SUV, resulting in surprisingly minimal damage. The pre-facelift Nexon, known for its five-star Global NCAP rating, held its ground remarkably well. Tata Motors has offered a full inspection to ensure no hidden issues.

title: 'People add very little value to ...': Ashwin on retirement call
content: Ravichandran Ashwin, India's veteran off-spinner, contemplated retirement post his 100th Test but extended his career, aiming for a farewell at Chennai. However, family separation and not starting the Australia series in Perth prompted a change of heart. The decision solidified at the Gabba, influenced by the emotional toll and perceived lack of understanding from others regarding his situation.

title: ‘You don't look from Kashmir’: Maha man recalls encounter with Pahalgam terror suspect
content: Adarsh Raut, a Jalna resident, believes he encountered a suspect in the Pahalgam terror attack a day before the incident. Raut recalls a man at a Baisaran Valley food stall questioning his religious identity and remarking on the sparse crowd. Following the attack that killed 26 tourists, Raut recognized the man's sketch released by the NIA.

title: Sunil Narine etches his name in T20 history with a big milestone for KKR
content: Sunil Narine's stellar all-round performance propelled Kolkata Knight Riders to a 14-run victory over Delhi Capitals in IPL 2025. Narine equaled the record for most T20 wickets for a single team, reaching 208 for KKR. He smashed a quick 27 with the bat and later took 3 crucial wickets, earning him Player of the Match.

title: World No.1 Sinner reveals he nearly quit tennis amid doping turmoil
content: Jannik Sinner considered quitting tennis after a three-month doping ban earlier this year, a period he described as deeply turbulent. Despite the unease and feeling unfairly judged by fellow players, he went on to win the Australian Open. Sinner is now eager to return to competition after the ban, dismissing claims of preferential treatment and focusing on his comeback.

title: Ex-WC winner to 14-yo Vaibhav: 'Talent alone doesn't guarantee success'
content: Madan Lal praises Vaibhav Suryavanshi's IPL performance, highlighting his talent but stressing the need for discipline and focus. Lal draws parallels to Sachin Tendulkar and Virat Kohli, acknowledging Suryavanshi's potential superstar status. He emphasizes the importance of family support, domestic cricket experience, and a strong work ethic for sustained success.

title: 'Fake news': India fact-checks misinformation by Pakistan on social media
content: In response to the Pahalgam attack, the Press Information Bureau (PIB) has debunked false social media posts from Pakistani users. These posts falsely claimed the removal of Northern Commander Lt Gen Suchindra Kumar and alleged the downing of an Indian Rafale fighter jet, both of which PIB confirmed as misinformation.

title: Govt rejigs NSA Board: Ex-R&AW chief Alok Joshi appointed head
content: The government has revamped the National Security Advisory Board, appointing Alok Joshi, the former R&AW chief, as its Chairman. The reconstituted board includes retired officers from the military and police services, along with a retired IFS officer. This multi-disciplinary body will provide long-term analysis and policy recommendations to the National Security Council.

title: Tamil actor Ajith Kumar hospitalised in Chennai for medical treatment
content: Tamil actor Ajith Kumar was admitted to a Chennai hospital due to abdominal discomfort, sparking concern among fans awaiting official updates. Recently, he was honored with the Padma Bhushan for his artistic contributions, celebrated by family and fans upon his return. Despite health concerns, his recent achievements highlight his significant impact on cinema and public life.

title: Australia elections: From 'donkey voting' to 'corflute' and 'tradies', all the slangs
content: Following Canada's election, Australia is gearing up for its federal election, pitting Anthony Albanese's Labor Party against Peter Dutton's Liberal-National coalition. Unique to Australian elections are compulsory voting and distinctive slang. Terms like 'donkey voting,' where voters randomly number candidates, 'corflutes,' the ubiquitous campaign posters, and 'stoushes,' referring to conflicts, add color to the political landscape.

title: ‘It’s a dead rat’: Man kills live-in partner, hides body in bed in Faridabad
content: In Faridabad's Jawahar Colony, Jitendra, 49, was arrested for allegedly strangling his live-in partner, Sonia, 40, after a dispute regarding his daughter. He hid her body in a bed compartment for two days, attempting to conceal the smell with incense. After the odour worsened, he fled, later confessing to his grandmother, who alerted the police on April 26.

title: Gunman walks into MP police station, shoots head constable over alleged grudge
content: In Satna district, Madhya Pradesh, a masked gunman invaded Jaitwara police station and shot head constable Prince Garg in the chest. The off-duty policeman was critically injured and is receiving treatment. Police have identified the suspect as Adarsh alias Acchu Sharma, a 20-year-old with a criminal history, and have launched a manhunt with twelve teams.

title: IAS officer Ashok Khemka, who saw 57 transfers, bids adieu to public service
content: IAS officer Ashok Khemka, known for his integrity and numerous transfers, is retiring after 34 years of service. He gained prominence for cancelling a land deal linked to Robert Vadra in 2012. Khemka, an IIT and TIFR alumnus with a law degree, served in various departments, often for short periods.

title: Could climate-conscious kids sway Australia's election?
content: Fueled by climate inaction, young Australian voters, now outnumbering baby boomers, are poised to make their voices heard in the upcoming election. Frustrated by the major parties' insufficient climate policies, Gen Z and Millennials are seeking drastic emissions reductions and a transition to renewable energy.

title: India may oppose IMF’s $1.3-billion loan to Pakistan
content: India is considering opposing a $1.3 billion IMF loan for Pakistan, citing concerns about terror support and fund misappropriation. The IMF board is set to evaluate the loan and the ongoing $7 billion bailout package.

title: Ahmedabad launches largest demolition drive after Pahalgam terror attack
content: Ahmedabad authorities launched a major anti-encroachment drive near Chandola lake, demolishing over 2,000 illegal shanties following heightened security concerns after the Pahalgam attack. The operation targeted suspected Bangladeshi nationals occupying government land, with over 6,500 detained and 450 confirmed as illegal residents. Authorities are investigating forged documents and the involvement of local figures.

title: Love & longing: Pahalgam attack disrupts cross-border family reunions, weddings
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, the Suthar family, Pakistani migrants in Jodhpur, faces immense anxiety. Tensions between India and Pakistan have indefinitely postponed reunions and weddings. Prakash Suthar's father's visa was cancelled, while his son Namit's decade-long engagement to Dr. Reena is now uncertain.

title: Deven Bharti, who investigated 26/11 attacks, is Mumbai's new police commissioner
content: Senior IPS officer Deven Bharti has been appointed as the new Mumbai Police Commissioner by the Maharashtra government. Bharti, who previously held influential positions during Devendra Fadnavis's tenure, was sidelined during the MVA government. His appointment follows anticipation of reshuffling key IPS roles since Fadnavis took over the home department.

title: Should you buy gold this Akshaya Tritiya?
content: Gold buying on Akshaya Tritiya: Gold has a tendency to perform in cycles and its recent performance has come in the last 5 years due to global uncertainty, rising inflation, geopolitical tensions, and strong central bank demand.

title: Punjabis in the house: 22 win Canadian federal elections
content: In Canada's federal elections, 22 candidates of Punjab origin secured victories. Liberals won 12 seats, while Conservatives took 10. Key wins included Anita Anand and Bardish Chagger. Jagmeet Singh faced defeat. Kamal Khera also lost her seat to Amarjit Gill. Tim Uppal retained his seat. Amarjeet Sohi, previously mayor of Edmonton, won his election. Sukh Dhaliwal also retained his seat.

title: 'Digital access fundamental right': SC rules to make e-KYC accessible for disabled
content: The Supreme Court has mandated changes to the digital KYC process, ensuring accessibility for persons with disabilities, including those with facial disfigurements and visual impairments. The court emphasized that digital access is a crucial component of the right to life under Article 21.

title: Bullet on street, blood on window: K'taka techie shoots family dead in US, kills self
content: Harshavardhana Kikkeri, an entrepreneur from Mysuru, allegedly killed his wife, Shwetha, and their son in their Newcastle, Washington home before committing suicide. The couple's younger son was unharmed. Authorities discovered the bodies after responding to a 911 call, with the medical examiner ruling the deaths of Shwetha and her son as homicides and Harshavardhana's as suicide. The motive remains unknown.

title: Cheteshwar Pujara overheard omission talks amid injury and father’s emergency, says wife
content: Puja Pujara's book reveals Cheteshwar Pujara overheard talks of dropping him from the Melbourne Test. This happened during India's 2018-19 Australia tour. He had a hamstring injury and his father had a medical emergency. He still performed well in the first Test. He kept his father's condition private. He later became Player of the Series as India won the series.

title: Banker-turned-milkman now delivers milk in Rs 50 lakh Audi across Faridabad
content: In Faridabad, Amit Bhadana, a former banker, delivers milk in his Audi A3 cabriolet. He covers 60-70km daily, serving around 120 litres to households. Amit switched from his Harley Davidson due to the summer heat. His family runs a dairy farm with cows and buffaloes. Despite fuel costs, he enjoys delivering milk in style.

content: Madden NFL 26 will be released on PC, PS5, Xbox Series X|S and Nintendo Switch 2 . the game will leave behind PS4 and Xbox One entirely, instead making its long-awaited return to a console for the first time since madden NFL 13 . a bit over a month after EA CFB 26, dedicated fans will have enough time to enjoy their high school and college careers .

content: the 2025 fantasy baseball season is here! get the gang back together, or start a brand new tradition . you're going to be able to find yourself a good number of prospective trade partners . there are always examples of the artificiality of player values .

title: College baseball Week 11: Top 25 rankings and what to watch
content: the longhorns remain the top of the class in all of baseball and the SEC . but it was the only top team to hold onto its spot as the rest of the top 10 underwent quite a shakeup . this week's biggest climber is NC State, which jumped 12 spots to no. 13 after sweeping Clemson .
